title.narrative: Integrated Multi-sectorial Response in Alamata, Raya Azebo and Ofla woredas of Tigray Region

description.narrative: SCI is seeking to deliver a 12 month integrated multi-sectorial Emergency Response project in Raya Alamata, Raya Azebo and ofla Hotspot priority 1 woredas of South Tigray Region. The thematic sector focus under this integrated project will be Nutrition, Food Security amp Livelihood, Health and WASH, which will be effective from May 15, 2016 to May 14, 2017. In these four sectors a total of 52,641 beneficiaries will be addressed through Nutrition amp Health (in Raya Azebo amp Ofla woredas), livelihood amp food security (in Raya Alamata, Raya Azebo amp Ofla woredas) and WASH (in Ofla woreda) sectors. The intervention includes: 1) In Raya zebo and Ofla woredas the Nutrition component will focus on detection and management of acute malnutrition. Children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM) with medical complications will be managed in the Therapeutic Feeding Unit (TFU) those severely malnourished without complications will be managed in the Outpatient Therapeutic Programme (OTP). Community mobilization and sensitization will aim to raise awareness on the OTP services and implementation modalities. A TFP data reporting system will be established and monthly collection, collation, analysis and dissemination will be facilitated. Communication and coordination with RHB, DPPB, UNICEF and WFP will be strengthened to ensure timely availability of required TFP/SFP supplies, materials and equipment. Logistical support for timely distribution of TFP supplies, materials and equipment (transport for supplies and materials) will be provided to the woredas. 2) In Raya zebo and Ofla woredas Health programming will focus on strengthening the management of SAM cases with medical complications, public health emergency management and support to vaccinations with especial emphasis on measles vaccination. In specific terms, SC will provide and preposition drugs and medical supplies for SAM cases with medical complications and anticipated disease outbreaks of Acute Watery Diarrhoea (AWD), Measles, Scabies and Malaria provide logistical support to conduct measles vaccination campaigns whenever needed strengthen outreach campaigns, disease surveillance and the community volunteer network. Under-five Girls and boys and pregnant and lactating women (PLW) will be the core target groups. 3) In its WASH intervention, the first focus is to address critical needs for water in Ofla woreda. The project will engage in increased access to safe water facilities in community through the construction of new water sources construction, rehabilitation of motorized water schemes ,replacement of submersible pump and generator for nonfunctional motorized schemes existing bore holes, and improving the capacity of the communities to use and operation amp maintenance for the facilities in selected kebeles of Ofla woreda. All interventions will be informed by the Sphere minimum standards and updated WASH guidance documents, as prepared by the WASH cluster. As well as responding to immediate WASH needs, this intervention will address problems faced by marginalized groups, including women and children. By making water more accessible, the amount of time women have to walk to collect water is reduced, enabling them more time to spend on other tasks, and reducing protection risks. 4) In all the three woredas, the projects food security and livelihood programming will Conduct cash transfer scheme through cash for work and provision of livestock feed and animal health services for core breeding stocks and emergency crop seeds.
